description:
io/ioutil: use pathname instead of name in docs to avoid confusion
caller of ioutil.TempFile() can use f.Name() to get "pathname"
of the temporary file, instead of just the "name" of the file.

Also remove an out-of-date comment about random number state.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

LGTM

http://codereview.appspot.com/6649054/diff/3/src/pkg/io/ioutil/tempfile.go
File src/pkg/io/ioutil/tempfile.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/6649054/diff/3/src/pkg/io/ioutil/tempfile.go#newcode45
src/pkg/io/ioutil/tempfile.go:45: // to find the path of the file.  It is the caller's responsibility to
how about pathname ? i think that's the correct term.

On 2012/10/12 20:48:42, r wrote:
http://codereview.appspot.com/6649054/diff/3/src/pkg/io/ioutil/tempfile.go#newcode45
> src/pkg/io/ioutil/tempfile.go:45: // to find the path of the file.  It is the
> caller's responsibility to
> how about pathname ? i think that's the correct term.
Done.

Also spotted an out-of-date comment, removed.
PTAL.

LGTM

https://codereview.appspot.com/6649054/diff/8002/src/pkg/io/ioutil/tempfile.go
File src/pkg/io/ioutil/tempfile.go (right):

src/pkg/io/ioutil/tempfile.go:15: // Random number state
s/$/./

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=fc8137c00f9c ***

io/ioutil: use pathname instead of name in docs to avoid confusion
caller of ioutil.TempFile() can use f.Name() to get "pathname"
of the temporary file, instead of just the "name" of the file.

Also remove an out-of-date comment about random number state.

R=golang-dev, r
CC=golang-dev

subject: code review 6649054: io/ioutil: use path instead of name to avoid confusion
